alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 5:33PM MST until September 21 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST/930 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following counties, Apache and Navajo. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MST /930 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 523 PM MST /623 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has fallen across the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Quartzite Canyon, Burntwater Wash, Ninemile Wash, Dead Wash, Bis Ii Ah Wash, Oak Ridge Wash, Fish Wash, Crazy Creek, Whitewater Arroyo, Piney Hill Creek, Seven Springs Wash, Wide Ruin Wash, Kinlichee Creek, Buell Wash, Cienega Creek, Sage House Wash, Sabito Wash, Bidahochi Wash, Zu√±i River, Black Soil Wash, Red Clay Wash, Cold Spring Wash, Coyote Wash, Morgan Canyon, Tse Bonito Wash, Beaver Dam Wash, Tiis Ndiitsooi Wash, Lone Tule Wash, Ruin Wash, Tse Deeshzhaai Wash, Digger Wash, Meadow Wash, Wildhorse Wash, Bonito Creek, Thsohotso Wash and Nazlini Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wide Ruins, Klagetoh, Pine Springs, Chambers, Sanders, Houck, Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site, Cornfields Chapter House, Kinlichee Chapter House, Window Rock, Petrified Forest National Park, Nazlini,Fort Defiance, Red Lake Chapter House, Canyon De Chelly National Monument, Ganado and Petrified Forest N.P. Headquarters. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 305 and 359. Highway 191 161 between mile markers 345 and 368. State Route 61 between mile markers 417 and 425. State Route 264 between mile markers 442 and 475. Highway 191 between mile markers 374 and 411. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
